headline: Nvidia Stock Erases Loss as TSMC Produces First ‘Wafer’ for Blackwell Chips on US Soil
summary: Nvidia  was edging up on Monday.  Cautious optimism about the artificial-intelligence boom and progress in its U.S. manufacturing plans look to be helping the stock.  Nvidia shares were up 0.2% after dropping as much as 0.8% in early trading..

headline: Platform9 Celebrates One Year Anniversary of Private Cloud Director for VMware Enterprises
summary: SAN JOSE, Calif., Oct. 20, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Today Platform9, the enterprise private cloud company, is commemorating the one year anniversary of Private Cloud Director. Private Cloud Director delivers a familiar private cloud experience for VMware users with the critical enterprise-grade features they need and runs on their existing server and storage infrastructure so they can maximize their private cloud investments. headline: Barclays turns more selective on AI chip stocks ahead of Q3 results
summary: Investing.com -- Barclays said it is becoming “more selective with names that have direct AI exposure” ahead of third-quarter earnings, recommending that investors consolidate risk around large-cap leaders Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA), Broadcom (NASDAQ: AVGO), and AMD (NASDAQ: AMD).

headline: Enterprises Shift VMware Strategies Amid Disruptions
summary: STAMFORD, Conn., October 20, 2025--Enterprises users of VMware are modifying their IT environments as they adapt to changing options for licensing and provider services, ISG says.

headline: A Look at Broadcom (AVGO) Valuation After Strong Profit Trends and Shareholder Returns
summary: Broadcom (AVGO) has recently come into focus as investors take a closer look at its long-term growth trajectory, especially after a strong revenue increase and solid profit trends captured in the latest annual results. See our latest analysis for Broadcom. Lately, Broadcom’s share price has continued its upward momentum, climbing more than 25% over the last three months and notching a year-to-date return of over 50%. Impressively, the company delivered a total shareholder return of nearly 96%...

headline: OpenAI big chip orders dwarf its revenues -- for now
summary: OpenAI is ordering hundreds of billions of dollars worth of chips in the artificial intelligence race, raising questions among investors about how the startup will finance these purchases."They will need hundreds of billions of dollars to live up to their obligations," said Gil Luria, managing director at D.A. Davidson, a financial consulting firm.
